title: ESPN's McMurphy: "I'd be stunned if they win the appeal"
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs ESPN's McMurphy: "I'd be stunned if they win the appeal" Bobby Lewis, WTSP 4:21 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Sep 5, 2015; Gainesville, FL, USA; Florida Gators quarterback Will Grier (7) works out prior to the game against the New Mexico State Aggies at Ben Hill Griffin Stadium. (Photo: Kim Klement, Kim Klement-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Florida Gators are appealing the 1-year suspension handed out by the NCAA on Monday to starting quarterback Will Grier. The freshman failed an NCAA performance enhancing drug test. Many reports claim it was the steroid-like drug, Ligandrol. 
The Gators are hopeful they'll get their leader back. The experts, aren't so sure. 
"I'd be stunned if they win the appeal," said ESPN college football insider Brett McMurphy. Florida QB Will Grier was suspended by the NCAA for using a banned substance. ESPN's Staff Writer Brett McMurphy comments on his story. WTSP 
McMurphy, who spent time in Tampa as a college football writer for the Tampa Tribune, spoke in the 10News studios about the process of appealing a suspension like the one Grier is facing. 
"What it means is he's out one calendar year. The rest of this year. The first six games of next year and if he ever tests positive for any banned substance through the NCAA his NCAA career is over," explained McMurphy. 
Florida cannot release details of what substance Grier was caught with because of personal medical laws. 
The 8th-ranked Gators (6-0) are off to the team's best start since 2012. Florida will face No. 6 LSU on Saturday. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1LsPdam TOP VIDEOS
